author: samwilsn
content:
I threw together a precompile based approach to sponsored transactions over here: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3074

Anyone know why the anydot folks stopped pursuing their opcode based approach?

author: evanvanness
content: I sent this to Patrick McCorry, he sent back:

author: evanvanness
content: We think its still a good solution, but for any.sender we no longer relay meta-transactions via an intermediary relay contract. We just send it directly to the target contract.

author: evanvanness
content: We realized if we want to support rollups, then we have to avoid .call() as the gas costs are quadratic for the calldata passed through it.

author: sky.cactus
content: Pretty sure it is linear with number of frames you have to pass the calldata through.

author: evanvanness
content:
so when you do a .call(), the memory allocation is quadratic. so for rollups, we were told for a full block the overhead of the .call() can be up to 30% of the gas cost
since so much calldata is being sent through the .call()
